string.text: Tritium inserts
Installation of luminous night-sights allows for easier target acquisition in low-light conditions.
Lightweight magazine
Replacing the magazine with a modern lightweight equivalent reduces the overall weight of the gun slightly.
Lightweight stock
Replacing the stock with a lightweight alternative reduces the overall weight of the weapon.
Rubberized grip
Installation of a more comfortable grip.
Improved muzzle brake
Installation of a more efficient muzzle brake significantly reduces overall recoil.
Barrel alignment
Improves muzzle velocity for a flatter trajectory.
Protective coating
The application of a special coating to the moving components can significantly reduce the amount of wear they receive.
Modify the gas system
Making certain modifications to the gas system can have beneficial characteristics, in this case an notable improvement in muzzle velocity and recoil reduction.
Reinforced trigger assembly
A refined trigger assembly allows for a faster rate of fire at the expense of some overall reliability.
Change the barrel's twist rate
Exchange the barrel for one with a twist rate that stabilizes the bullet better over longer ranges, improving accuracy.
High-capacity magazine (20 rounds)
Higher-capacity magazines means fewer reloads during combat and improves the odds of survival.
Lightweight forend
Replacing the forend with a lightweight alternative reduces the overall weight of the weapon.
High-strength bolt carrier
Replacing the standard bolt carrier and firing pin with ones made from high-strength alloys significantly increases the number of firing cycles they can withstand before servicing.
Align the bolt mechanism
Precise adjustment of the bolt components allows for higher accuracy.
Balance the bolt group
Balancing of the bolt group components reduces the barrel's departure from line of sight when firing.
Wear-resistant trigger components
Replacing the various parts of the trigger assembly with equivalents made from more durable materials improves the overall longevity of the weapon.
Rubberized forend
Makes it easier to grip and handle the weapon.
Spring replacement
Returns the bolt group to its firing position faster between cycles, improving the rate of fire.
Improved buttstock
Installation of an anatomical rubberized buttstock reduces the recoil felt by the shooter.
Install a cheek pad
Installing a cushioned cheek pad on the stock reduces some of the effects of recoil transferred to the shooter.
Heavy-duty components
Replacing standard parts with analogs made of high-strength alloys increases the weapon's durability.
